intro: Jussiaea nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its delicate, herbaceous stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with prominent veins that give it its scientific name. Jussiaea nervosa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
